title: MAINTENANCE PROGRAM ENGINEER (STRUCTURE)
description: SONOVISION’s Maintenance Program team supports customers in activities relevant to aviation maintenance planning & execution, maintenance production, optimization, engineering support, and consultation supports with capability to customize niche scope based on customer’s need. Key Responsibilities: As a Maintenance Program Engineer, you will hold important responsibility in contributing to customer’s product (aircraft) safety. Your key responsibilities will include: Perform technical assessment of maintenance report/findings from operator or maintenance organization: To identify if the report is relevant for the selected maintenance task, To categorize valid/relevant maintenance reports base on the applicable rules provided by aircraft manufacturer / OEM, To analyze and provide detailed technical evaluation of the maintenance reports base on assessment criteria provided by aircraft manufacturer / OEM. Analyze and compile technical justification upon completing technical evaluation of affected maintenance tasks: To produce technical justification with the result of the statistical data analysis base on the given policy by aircraft manufacturer / OEM, To write technical justification for possible escalation/de-escalation of the maintenanceinterval base on Design Office feedback, in-service experience and Scheduled Maintenance Team feedback, To provide recommendation/proposal for new maintenance interval. Coordinate, consult and/or working with multi-stakeholder team involving flight ops, scheduled maintenance, design office, operators: o To obtain required technical and/or operational inputs, o Timely follow-up open topics for affected technical dossiers, o Review & update action plans for achieving expected changes. Responsible to conduct/attend technical meetings with aircraft manufacturer / OEM (Airbus departments such as Design Office, Safety Assessment team, Scheduled Maintenance Team), Operator, Authority, etc. Ensure transfer of in-service experience and maintenance program activities to the management, to other departments for continuous improvement. Anticipation studies and industrialization preparation relevant to aircraft structural repair projects and maintenance programs. Skills and Competencies: Strong analytical skill within engineering scope, with aerospace engineering background. Possesses strong knowledge with aircraft maintenance documentations such as (AMM, AMP, IPC, SRM etc) and preferably expertise with Airbus fleet. Possesses technical knowledge and experience in aircraft maintenance planning, procedures and operations. Proficient in interpreting aircraft structure drawings and GD&T. Understanding of aerospace materials, heat/surface treatments, fasteners, and bonding techniques. Ability to work in a team and to be autonomous to complete full task alone. Excellent verbal communication & presentation skills. Qualification : Diploma in Aircraft Maintenance or Aviation Engineering, or equivalent. Experience : >3 years of experience in aircraft structure repair or maintenance program. Work Environment: Office setting. May be required to travel based on project needs. Benefits: Group Health insurance after three (3) months of employment. Professional development opportunities.

title: WORKSHOP TECHNICIAN - AVIONICS AS565 / AS332
description: If you meet the requirement, please call/Whatsapp: Mr. Richard - (Recruiter) Mobile:  +6016 9368682 BASIC FUNCTION AND SCOPE (SUMMARY) Assist the Avionics Supervisor to accomplish aviation unit and intermediate maintenance inspections services. QUALIFICATIONS High School Completion of a formal avionics training course from an accredited military or civilian aeronautical school. Knowledgeable on The Army Maintenance Management System (TAMMS) preferable. EXPERIENCE Minimum of 5 Years Must have a minimum of 5 years working with rotary aircraft powertrain systems and subsystems. LANGUAGE SKILLS Must be able to read, write and understand English. DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Repairs, replaces, and performs operational/functional tests on instruments, radios, navigation and aircraft flight control equipment, stabilization systems, avionics systems. Troubleshoots equipment and traces avionic equipment wiring harnesses using technical manuals and schematic drawings to diagnose and isolate faults and effect repairs. Diagnose malfunctions using special and common hand tools, test measurement and diagnostic equipment. Requisition aircraft parts, and maintain shop and bench stock for repair of aircraft avionics equipment. Inspects and prepares forms and records in accordance with DA PAM 738-751. Train host national personnel on the proper maintenance of the avionics/instrument systems. Responsible for tools and equipment inventory assigned by the supervisor. Responsible for replacing electronic parts on PCB level using soldering / resoldering technics. SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITY None. SUPERVISORY RECEIVED Reports to Supervisor COMMUNICATIONS Must be able to communicate well with others, instill a teamwork mentality, and lead by example. OTHER FACTORS Must have good knowledge of Special Operations mission requirements, equipment and maintenance programs. Must have strong program management background with a good understanding of contract law and terminology used in aviation contracts. Must have a good working knowledge of all computer applications. Must have strong charismatic and delegating attributes. Must work well with other departments.

title: MECHANIC – 2ND LINE SUPER PUMA AS332
description: If you meet the requirement, please call/Whatsapp: Mr. Richard - (Recruiter) Mobile:  +6016 9368682 BASIC FUNCTION AND SCOPE (SUMMARY) Performs scheduled and unscheduled aircraft maintenance tasks. Reports directly to the Supervisor for all aspects QUALIFICATIONS FAA Airframe and Powerplant Certificate or industry equivalent. High School Diploma Graduation from military or commercial aircraft maintenance or course preferred. EXPERIENCE Minimum of 5 Years Aviation Maintenance Minimum of 3Years Mechanic on aircraft type. Must have thorough knowledge in the use of common tools, special tools, test equipment, and aviation ground support equipment used in performing maintenance on the relevant aircraft. LANGUAGE SKILLS Must be able to read, write and understand English. DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Assist the maintenance supervisor to accomplish the company's mission. Performs inspection, servicing, and repair of aircraft and equipment IAW applicable technical publications and local policies and procedures. Assists in ensuring aircraft and equipment are maintained in a high state of mission readiness. Impart the knowledge of duties and responsibilities in such a manner (advice support and OJT training) to permit assimilation of the customer's trainees; the final aim being to enable the customer's technicians to attain gradual full capacity to carry out maintenance. Completes all forms, records, and documents recording aircraft maintenance activities IAW DA PAM 738-751, applicable technical publications, and local policies and procedures. May be requested to perform rated and/or non-rated crew member duties to facilitate completion of maintenance activities such as Maintenance Test Flights, Maintenance Operational Checks, and operation of diagnostic equipment during ground and/or flight (subject to completion of a flight physical). Other duties as assigned by Supervisor or Team Lead. SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITY None. SUPERVISORY RECEIVED Reports to Supervisor COMMUNICATIONS Must be able to communicate well with others, in still a teamwork mentality, and lead by example. OTHER FACTORS Must be willing to travel in support of the company’s operational requirements. Knowledge of computer applications. Basic use of MS Office suite and applications (Word, Excel, Power Point, Project, Outlook), Adobe and the internet.

title: FLYING INSTRUCTOR - EMIRATES FLIGHT TRAINING ACADEMY
url: https://flygoshjobs.com/job/FLYING INSTRUCTOR - EMIRATES FLIGHT TRAINING ACADEMY/BB3C27B45C13EC4501E55DCF9C7B3251
apply_url: https://flygoshjobs.com/job/FLYING INSTRUCTOR - EMIRATES FLIGHT TRAINING ACADEMY/BB3C27B45C13EC4501E55DCF9C7B3251
description: In this role:  You will provide training and flying instruction to ab-initio cadets. Conduct pre and post flight training briefings to ensure cadets have the requisite knowledge and understand the process and procedure fully. Conduct and deliver flying skills training in aircraft, simulator, and ground instruction to ensure the cadets meet the prescribed standards of flying. Conduct regular checks for cadets to ensure they meet the course standards. Ensure the safety of the cadets is paramount and report incidents to the concerned personnel for any violations and situations that may affect the safety of the operation. Monitor cadet’s proficiency and progress on regular basis and generate accurate reports of their performance. Research, develop, and recommend new training methods to further improve the standard of learning and performance; and, Deliver other flying-related training initiatives as directed by the CFI. To be considered for this role, you must meet the below requirements: You must have experience as an Ab-initio flying instructional experience in a large ATO. Minimum 700hrs Total Time, 500hrs Instructional time, 200hrs IFR time. Minimum GCAA or any ICAO Commercial Pilot License (CPL) or Airline Transport Pilot License (ATPL) with a Single Engine Class Rating. Minimum Flight Instructor Rating with Night and Instrument privileges. Class 1 Medical Certificate without restrictions. ICAO English Language Proficiency level 5 or greater. Exceptional instructional technique with an understanding of a broad range of teaching methodologies. Computer literate. Qualification Please make sure you attach the following documents to your online application: ﻿ CV Passport CPL/ATPL License or Certificate Class 1 Medical Certificate with no limitations (except visual corrections) Last 3 pages of logbook ICAO English Language Proficiency Certificate* No-incident/accident certificate issued by a Civil Aviation Authority* “Licence Verification Letter” as this is required by the GCAA for Licence conversion*

title: SYNTHETIC FLIGHT EXAMINER (GROUND) BOEING
description: As part of Emirates Airline’s continued growth, we are seeking experienced aviation professionals to join our Flight Training department in non-flying, ground-based roles as Synthetic Flight Examiner (SFE). This position is responsible for conducting pilot proficiency evaluations using Flight Simulation Training Devices (FSTDs) and overseeing ground-based assessments in accordance with GCAA regulations and Emirates’ standards. Conduct regulatory and company-mandated proficiency checks, skill tests, and assessments using Flight Simulation Training Devices (FSTDs), in line with GCAA regulations and Emirates' training standards. Evaluate pilot performance during recurrent, type rating, recency, and upgrade training sessions, ensuring consistency and objectivity in line with established benchmarks. Complete and submit accurate and detailed examination reports and assessments using the electronic reporting system within prescribed timelines. Identify performance gaps and recommend remedial or additional training as required to uphold safety and competency standards. Provide detailed feedback to training management regarding pilot performance trends, systemic issues, or potential improvements in instructional methodology and training effectiveness. Support training program development, course reviews, and other departmental initiatives related to simulator and ground-based pilot evaluation. Qualification Hold or have held a CPL Commercial Pilot License MPL Multicrew Pilot License or ATPL Airline Transport Pilot License Experience Minimum 12 months as an active Examiner Minimum 1500 hours flight time as a pilot on multipilot aeroplane Advanced communication and leadership skills

title: HR BUSINESS PARTNERSHIPS MANAGER, DNATA TRAVEL GROUP
url: https://flygoshjobs.com/job/HR BUSINESS PARTNERSHIPS MANAGER, DNATA TRAVEL GROUP/68784C2F5E861BEED3C4413B333E9C58
apply_url: https://flygoshjobs.com/job/HR BUSINESS PARTNERSHIPS MANAGER, DNATA TRAVEL GROUP/68784C2F5E861BEED3C4413B333E9C58
description: In this role, you will:   Employee Relations - Mediate complex issues and personalities. Work closely with the line to enable them to manage investigations and hearings. Manage and resolve highly complex employee relations issues. Conduct effective, thorough and objective investigations. Identify and escalate cases considered high risk to the appropriate manager and partner with the Employee Assistance Programme (EAP) to support managers and employees with specific needs or sensitive cases. HR Partnering - Provide HR guidance when delivering HR products and align products to the department requirements to support the department to achieve their goals. Provide advice and guidance for managers on employee or organisational related queries, whether approached directly or via HR Shared Services. Ensure HR matters are handled fairly and consistently in line with company requirements and local employment laws. Project & HR Calendar Delivery - Act as a point-of-contact and support on key HR projects or events. Support activities in the HR calendar such as implementation of annual pay reviews (merit pot allocation), profit share, etc. Managing Attendance - Provide a targeted coaching and advisory service to managers on attendance management. In partnership with the line and HR Shared Services, manage complex cases of long/short term sickness absence, industrial injury and occupational health referrals in accordance with company policy. Organisation Changes - Support the roll out of organisational and HR change initiative / projects which have significant people implications. This includes organisational design, job role review and job evaluation. Drive and communicate strategic and operational change in the business. Performance Culture - Help drive organisational performance through performance management by working with line managers with goal setting, development planning, individual reviews, and in the provision of relevant information in relation to trends and areas of focus or improvement. Culture and Engagement - Provide relevant insights regarding engagement and departmental culture, based on interaction with employees through formal and informal channels, and become involved in projects that are focused on the improvement of departmental culture and/or engagement levels. Improvement Focus - Identify HR process and propose improvements with a focus on customer experience, simplification and efficiency. Develop and promote feedback mechanisms for employees and managers to influence the continuous improvement of HR services and process. Lead change projects within the team or support larger/more complex projects through collaboration with colleagues. Source, select and develop - Involvement in both local and overseas recruitment campaigns, applying sound selection practices and methodologies to attract and appoint top talent into the business, coaching managers throughout the process. Identifies training needs for business units and individual executive coaching needs and provide input to HRBP to the development of the strategy (specific to international) Quality delivery focus - Ensure strong relationships and networks are built across the HR teams to ensure a seamless, quality-led service to the business. Qualification To be considered for the role, you must meet the below requirements: Bachelor’s degree in a related subject (HR, Business, Humanities). Minimum 8 years of experience in Human Resources, with experience in an advisory capacity. Technologically savvy, customer orientated, and solutions focussed. Able to coach, mentor, build positive relationships and collaborate effectively. Able to remain impartial, use diplomacy and resolve conflict whilst maintaining effective relationships. Analytical, able to identify trends and offer solutions. Able to travel to various locations across Dubai and internationally. You’ll have an edge if you have: ﻿ Sound knowledge of Aviation, Airport operations or Travel management industry. Professional accreditation (CIPD, AHRI or equivalent).

title: HEAD OF OPERATIONAL PERFORMANCE, DNATA AIRPORT OPERATIONS
url: https://flygoshjobs.com/job/HEAD OF OPERATIONAL PERFORMANCE, DNATA AIRPORT OPERATIONS/48CBA3357169B6EFA6643DBEE52A90BD
apply_url: https://flygoshjobs.com/job/HEAD OF OPERATIONAL PERFORMANCE, DNATA AIRPORT OPERATIONS/48CBA3357169B6EFA6643DBEE52A90BD
description: In this role, you will: Lead and support operational transformation and strategic programmes across dnata Airport Operations using Management of Change frameworks and industrial engineering tools (e.g. Lean, Six Sigma, process mapping), delivering measurable improvements and supporting post-implementation adoption. Manage and maintain a global performance measurement framework covering operational, safety, financial, and productivity KPIs Ensure consistent reporting and enable data-driven decision-making across business units. Support operational input into new business opportunities and integrations by contributing to resource planning, budgeting, and implementation readiness. Collaborate with M&A and Commercial teams to ensure alignment with dnata Airport Operations strategic priorities. Conduct benchmarking exercises with leading service providers and airlines to identify best practices and performance gaps, implement improvements, and facilitate global forums for knowledge-sharing, innovation, and alignment with industry standards. Establish structured communication with internal and external stakeholders to resolve service issues, identify synergies, and support consistent service delivery across locations. Collaborate with IT and business units to enhance automation, system integration, and resource modelling (e.g., RMS, INFORM) for improved planning, rostering, and capacity management. Lead and develop the Operational Performance and Transformation team, assigning responsibilities, building capabilities to support global operations and deliver impactful change. Qualification To be considered for the role, you must meet the below requirements: Bachelor’s degree in relevant discipline.  Minimum of 10 years’ experience in Airport Operations Management. Industry experience in a management role with a major airline or ground handler. Robust knowledge of airport handling operations and operations management methodologies, systems, and improvement. Advanced analytical, data-driven problem-solving capabilities. Advanced relationship-building, cross-functional collaboration, negotiation, and stakeholder management skills. Proven leadership, team management, and change-management expertise. Experience managing large cross-functional strategic change projects in Airport Operations. Excellent written, verbal, presentation, and professional writing skills. Strong commercial and financial acumen. You will have an edge, if you have: ﻿ Master’s degree (MBA or equivalent) in a relevant discipline. Large-scale operational transformation experience within the airport operations industry, airports, or with airlines.

title: ADMINISTRATOR - FLIGHT CREW
description: In this role, you will: Ensure administrative work undertaken complies with quality standards and is in accordance with department procedures, standards and policy. Support the coordination of administration material, requests, mail and equipment on a daily basis and as required for department related activities and corporate events. Provide a comprehensive admin systems support service including data entry, maintenance, update and support of relevant databases and in house equipment. Record transactional data in appropriate systems and produce reports as required. Collate, analyse, archive and retrieve data / information when necessary. Handle customer/employee requests, actioning transactions and queries in a timely manner and actively seek feedback to provide a high level of service with admin related queries. Obtain and disseminate information from relevant sections if not available. Complete timely and accurate processing of transactions, including audit, checking and necessary reconciliation for settlement of bills pertaining to corporate expenses and charges, as well as issuing relevant documentation. Provide comprehensive support in maintaining, issuing and tracking supplies, basic fixtures, fittings, and facilities utilisation to ensure safe operation where applicable. Conduct briefings and inductions/training as required for new joiners across grades 1-4. Compile induction material and equipment required (as well as maintenance) for briefings/training. Make suggestions for improvements and provide statistical and/or productivity analysis. Allocate tasks for staff and update staff /team on new procedure/processes. Qualification To be considered for this role, you must meet the below requirements: Proven experience as an office administrator, office assistant or relevant role Outstanding communication and interpersonal abilities You will have an edge if you have: ﻿ Excellent organizational skills Familiarity with office management procedures and basic admin principles Excellent knowledge of MS Office and office management software Proficiency in managing and analysing data.

title: JUNIOR ENGINEERING MAINTENANCE ASSISTANT - CABIN
description: In this role you will:  Carry out the cleaning of tools/equipment/components utilized. Assist with basic maintenance tasks for the aircraft and components as directed by the senior staff i.e. lubrication. Must alert the designated Engineer of any defects noted while carrying out tasks. Maintain a safe and clean working environment in order to minimize safety hazards. Ensure cleanliness of vehicles and other maintenance support equipment as required for the respective area. Assist in the maintenance and usage of tools and equipment as required by specific maintenance tasks. Ensure tools and equipment are cleaned and properly stowed and spares are returned to racks. Carry out any other tasks assigned by the supervisors in order to achieve work targets. Qualification To be considered for this role, you must meet the below requirements: 10 Years schooling or equivalent Ability to operate equipment, machinery and tools in a safe and efficient manner Ability to understand written or verbal instructions Safety Sensitive Role: Yes

title: HR DIRECTOR, DNATA SINGAPORE
description: In this role, you will Drive the implementation of people strategies and HR systems aligned with organisational objectives and growth, using data-driven insights to influence executive decision-making.  Partner with leadership team to design and execute integrated talent strategies covering sourcing, recruitment, onboarding, development, and succession planning.  Develop, update, and ensure consistent application of HR policies and procedures in compliance with local laws, corporate governance requirements, and the Employee Handbook.  Manage the HR budget, optimise resource utilisation, and oversee competitive compensation, benefits, and incentive programmes aligned with market trends and organisational priorities.  Lead continuous improvement of HR systems and processes to enhance employee experience, drive operational efficiency, and embed best practices relevant to business needs.  Anticipate and address business challenges by delivering proactive HR solutions that balance short-term priorities with long-term strategic goals.  Ensure compliance with employment legislation, regulatory requirements, corporate governance, and internal controls.  Make people-related decisions based on sound risk management, authority limits, and appropriate executive consultation.  Foster strong stakeholder relationships internally with business leaders, employees, and corporate teams, and externally with unions, regulatory bodies, and industry partners.  Manage union relationships and Collective Bargaining Agreements, promoting open communication and collaboration.  Collaborate across dnata entities to share best practices, build networks, and identify opportunities for alignment and synergy.  Champion dnata’s Vision, Mission, and Values, embedding them into all HR initiatives to create a consistent and engaging employee experience.  Set clear performance objectives, drive accountability, and support leaders in managing and developing high-performing teams.  Prioritise workplace safety, role-modelling safe behaviours and ensuring alignment with dnata’s safety standards.  Demonstrate professionalism and integrity in all interactions, acting as a trusted advisor and role model across the organisation. Qualification To be considered for the role, you must meet the below requirements Bachelor's degree in a relevant subject (HR, Business, Humanities)and 8+ years’ experience in in a senior HR leadership role, preferably in a multi-national organisation. Strong regional HR experience with solid understanding of employment legislation, HR processes, and best practice. Ability to interpret and apply Singapore employment laws to HR strategies and solutions. Proven experience with HR systems, including implementation, integration, and adoption. Expertise in business transformation, programme management, and change management. Experience managing industrial relations in a unionised environment, including annual pay negotiations and communications. Data-driven approach with the ability to deliver insights to support decision-making. Strong leadership capabilities with financial acumen to plan and manage budgets. You’ll have an edge if you have ﻿ Professional accreditation (CIPD or equivalent)

description: In this role, you will: Monitor the daily schedule of the Departmental Head/Manager and furnish required information/documentation for meetings/appointments, by co-ordinating with sources within and outside the Department. Provide secretarial services to the Departmental Head/Manager by attending to routine administrative paper work. Screen incoming mails and telephone calls, action responses, re-direct correspondence and collate to the appropriate person obtaining additional information where necessary. Supervise the Department's attendance records, overtime claims and verify such claims where necessary and ensure that overtime claims are processed and forwarded to Salary Admin. Department for payment. Be fully conversant with the activities of the organisation in order to liaise effectively with senior executives and external contacts on behalf of the Departmental Head/Manager. Maintain Petty Cash accounts by verifying authenticity of claims ensuring figures are accurately recorded. Control and handle cash transactions to bring accounts to balance. Qualification To be considered for this role, you must meet the below: Secretarial qualification preferable At least 4 years experience in an administrative capacity in a medium or large size company with administrative skills. You will have an edge if you have: ﻿ Must be fully competent in MS Office applications. Fluency in spoken and written English, pleasant telephone etiquettes and the ability to prioritise work.

title: SALES EXECUTIVE
description: To achieve agreed sales revenue targets by developing and maintaining an effective professional liaison with trade, incentive houses, associations and the various stakeholders in these segments. Help to position Dubai as a global MICE destination and work with the various stakeholders to increase 3rd/4th freedom traffic flows in these segments. Maintain and develop relationships with specified DMC,   trade partners and associations to develop and maximize all revenue opportunities which includes existing revenue and new revenue potential. Build and maintain strong relationships with the various Travel Association stakeholders such as Thai Travel Agent Association, International Travel Association (ITA), and Tourism Offices to position Emirates as a leading  a ssociation carrier with a global reach. Work closely with the Global Sales Team, the channel ,  Country Manage r  and  S ales  M anagers to manage strategic accounts and ensure that business opportunities are shared across territories with the respective colleagues Maintain a minimum average weekly call rate to existing and new customer base based on revenue portfolio and account needs as agreed with the Sales manager. Update the weekly sales plan in salesforce.com and report outcomes/actions of the sales calls in the system Develop and implement the agreed marketing and sales plans with all Key Accounts within the segment.  Create action plans to present to the Sales Manager based on market needs and feedback, competitor’s activities and subsequently assist in designing and developing the sales and marketing strategies for the territory to ensure growth in revenue and market share for Emirates. Implement and monitor sales strategies in the territory to ensure that the travel trade and traveling public in general are made aware of the existence, variety, competitive prices, and quality of Emirates products available.  Co-ordinate the distribution of quality marketing and promotional collateral and material. Act a s  an Emirates ambassador within in the assigned sales territory and represent Emirates during functions To achieve, organise, control, and monitor passenger sales targets and marketing goals of the company in the outstation. Qualification Qualifications & Experience: Experience in all aspects of the airline/travel trade sales environment   Knowledge/Skills: Ability to negotiate and communicate effectively at all levels Knowledge of Microsoft Word/Excel and Power Point Fluent spoken and written English. Excellent interpersonal skills and a pleasant, outgoing personality. Must have the right to live and work in Indonesia.

title: SUCCESSION PLANNING & PERFORMANCE MANAGER
description: In this role, you will: Support the establishment of Group-wide performance and talent management strategies. Lead the development, implementation, and evaluation of performance and talent management initiatives to drive employee engagement, productivity, and performance. Provide subject matter expertise and design support to our HR Business Partners who will drive the execution with the business. Adopt cutting-edge research, tools, and technology to ensure best practices are incorporated into our processes, practices, and systems. Use performance insights to inform talent management, selection, and promotion practices. Design and deliver an enterprise-level reporting function that equips our senior business leaders with meaningful performance insights. Foster a continuous feedback culture by designing and implementing mechanisms and tools that promote regular and meaningful communication between managers and employees. Qualification To be considered for this role, you will need the following requirements: 8+ years of experience in Human Resources, including training. Minimum Bachelor’s degree in a related field, preferably in Human Resources or equivalent. Experience in a people development role, with a strong focus on driving a performance culture. Experience in performance management, talent management, or a related HR function. Significant experience in analysing and reporting trends from enterprise-level data. You will have an edge if you have: ﻿ The ability to build a culture of continuous feedback, drive performance excellence, and influence senior leaders effectively. Strong critical thinking and analytical skills, with the ability to challenge the status quo and draw meaningful conclusions from data. A proactive, resilient, and courageous mindset, with a positive can-do attitude and the ability to persevere through challenges. Exceptional interpersonal skills, including teamwork, collaboration, and the ability to form effective relationships across all levels. Intellectual curiosity, adaptability, and a growth mindset, with a focus on improvement, innovation, and handling sensitive information with discretion.

title: CLIENT RELATIONS MANAGER, DNATA TRAVEL
description: In this role, you will Monitor client revenues for multinational and large local accounts, recommend improvements, and ensure overall account profitability. Liaise with regional and local client teams to establish standardised travel policies, accounting practices, corporate deals, and contractual obligations; lead communication and produce clear MIS reports to support decision-making. Track market trends and competitor activities and share insights and recommendations with the line manager. Communicate the full product portfolio to clients and frontline teams, ensuring timely updates on policy decisions and relevant industry developments. Manage financial bids for consolidations, present recommendations, and lead responses to client RFIs/RFPs. Represent the business in regional and global client meetings, advise on required follow-ups, and showcase the value of partnering through strong product knowledge. Develop pricing, product solutions, or campaigns aligned to client expectations and requirements. Lead or participate in projects to drive process efficiencies, improve SOPs, and apply best practices in line with Group project management standards. Guide, train, coach, and review performance of UAE Sales team members to maintain a high-performance culture. Work within Regional/Global agreements, meeting client deadlines without compromising data or proposal quality. Negotiate with vendors on behalf of clients to secure optimal deals, maximise savings, and enhance brand exposure. Coordinate with service departments (Revenue Accounts, IT, E-Commerce, Product, CASA, Credit Control, etc.) to ensure operational support, timely payment recovery, and effective issue resolution for clients. Qualification To be considered for the role, you must meet the below requirements ﻿ Bachelor’s degree with 8+ years’ experience in sales or customer relations, including at least 3 years managing regional and global clients. Strong negotiation skills, with the ability to engage confidently at senior management level. Skilled in conducting statistical reviews, analysing results, and recommending improvements to operational methods and processes. Strong communication and presentation skills, including presenting to senior management. Ability to prioritise workload effectively and focus on initiatives that deliver the greatest business impact.

title: RESERVATIONS & TICKETING OPERATIONS MANAGER
description: In this role, you will:  Continually review and audit the services and processes delivered against SLAs and using complaints/feedback received. Proactively seek feedback from the network, CSSMs etc. Recommend improvements in work methods, systems and procedures. Implement changes were appropriate. Provide ongoing feedback to, and create outstanding working relationships with, key operational business partners both within Commercial and outside e.g. RO, Planning, Apt Svcs, NPSD, CASA, Training, Skywards IT etc. Identify operational trends and compile and produce monthly reports for Management on operational functions. Focus on any flaws in service delivery and ensure corrective action is taken. Manage and review YM functions and ensure we are complementing their objectives especially with out of hours support. With guidance from VP- Res & Tktg, develop strategies and implement processes to achieve delivery of specific Res and ticketing processes and/or systems. Ensure their success by monitoring performance of staff and internal customer feedback as well as CASA surveys etc. Manage resources within corporate policies related to technology usage, data protection and performance matters. Ensure that each direct report covers their area of responsibility and that PM, staff training and development is followed through with laid out plans for all staff in respective grades and areas. To lead by example, by displaying behaviour which reflects departmental values, and adopt a leadership style to maximise utilisation of resources and abilities of staff and maintain cohesiveness within the team at all times. Act as the Res and ticketing focal point for the NCC, liaising with SMNC, MAS etc. on coverage at NCC for disruption rebooking handling. Attend strategic update meetings on NCC as required. Manage a team of Duty Controllers and support staff in NCC and EGHQ to provide 24 hour network wide operational support on reservations/ticketing issues. Ensure all staff are fully versed with standards and corporate guidelines expected in each role. Lead an efficient, courteous and customer-centred Help Desk in order to improve operational responsiveness and effectiveness for the network on both reservations and ticketing issues. Areas of focus are 24/7 operations, Schedule loading, disruption handling, MEDA cases, Group PNR servicing, PNR servicing etc. Provide Business analysis support for any projects that impact the passenger handling within the Res Tktg system. Collate, analyse and validate requirements and ensure completeness and quality prior to passing these to IT. Suggest creative solutions and work closely with IT to ensure change scope/objectives are met. Ensure long term plans are discussed with Manager R&T Systems for evaluation into the future systems. Support Manager R&T Systems to analyse the business plans, policies, processes and practices of large functional changes and to recommend process and IT system changes which would bring benefits in quantifiable terms. These would include reducing unit costs of operation, increasing revenue generated, improving customer service or processes and decision support. Qualification To be considered for this role, you must meet the below requirements: ﻿ Bachelor's Degree or Honours with 8+ years of experience in Commercial/Sales, Reservations/Ticketing. 8+ years experience in an airline, of which, a minimum of 5 years should be at a managerial level in the Reservations, ticketing and procedures field.  Thorough knowledge of Reservation and ticketing operational and Industry standards as well as knowledge of Apt Services procedures and systems.

title: WORKSHOP MAINTENANCE ENGINEER I (HYDRAULICS OR PNEUMATICS)
url: https://flygoshjobs.com/job/ WORKSHOP MAINTENANCE ENGINEER I (HYDRAULICS OR PNEUMATICS)/C9ED81463DD35606EC71EB77FF3758E5
apply_url: https://flygoshjobs.com/job/ WORKSHOP MAINTENANCE ENGINEER I (HYDRAULICS OR PNEUMATICS)/C9ED81463DD35606EC71EB77FF3758E5
description: As a  Workshop Maintenance Engineer I (Hydraulics & Pneumatics)  you will  Carry out aircraft components maintenance and servicing tasks in compliance with manufacturer and safety procedures. Ensure that assigned aircraft components are maintained as per latest revisions of approved authority Technical Publications such as CMM, Aircraft documentation, Technical Notices, Quality Notices, and Engineering Procedures Manual etc. Ensure that personal approvals/licences are valid and applicable to aircraft components type/scope  Determine if tooling/equipment used is serviceable and appropriate for the task and use specialised tooling where required. Ensure that trouble shooting procedures/tools used for fault rectification are carried out in a cost effective and efficient manner.  Ensure that all activities performed are carried out in accordance with all safety rules and regulations and in adherence to company procedures, highlighting a deficiencies/requirements through the effective use of reporting tools. Ensure all work locations are kept clean and excellent housekeeping conditions are maintained.  Maintain effective communication with Colleagues including Managers and Senior Engineers to ensure a seamless flow of information and to highlight any potential operational issues.  Manage the performance of staff using performance review process and system. Ensure SMART goal setting, interim/annual reviews and development plans are in place for assigned staff members in accordance with company procedures.  Attend training/recurrent modules as required to enhance skills and comply with CAR 145 requirements.  Ensure resources and manpower available is support of the business needs allowing targets/milestones to be adequately achieved.  Ensure that available resources are utilized fully to meet the business needs. Ensure for all staff allocated to him/her and themselves to efficiently clock on/clock off job cards in the process of performing their usual duties. Must be available to assume duties and responsibilities of shift manager/senior engineer shift whenever delegated by the section manager.  Specific Functions for Airframe Components:  Proactively identify New Capabilities build-up opportunities of aircraft components and conduct feasibility study, justify the requirement of establishing New Capabilities via Research and Development (R&D), Cost Benefit Analysis (Business Cases) to enhance the workshop's capabilities. Be conversant with 145 AMO regulatory framework. Liaise with company internal Compliance Monitoring teams for obtaining necessary Regulatory approvals for shop activities.  Lead the project to build up the agreed new aircraft components capabilities until it is approved by regulatory. Liaise with Fleet Technical Management (Engineering Technical Services - ETS), Part 21 DOA, UAE GCAA MOA (Manufacturing Organization), Component Repair or Reliability Departments for gathering facts and solid justification data for the capability establishment. Define new Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) or Process Instruction Manuals / Stage Sheets / Work Order Job Cards that allows shop engineers to practice new capability deliverables. Develop and deliver training programs to enhance the technical proficiency of the Work Shop's staff. Introduce external training / refresher training to allow Authorization approval scopes of certifying engineers remain valid. Liaise with Technical Publications, ETS and ensure all Work Shop publications (CMM, CMM-TR, SILs, CMM-ICA documents) are available for Work Shop Personnel access.  Coordinate with internal related stake holders to implement the built/approved new capabilities in the workshop until the output of production is fully compliance with regulations. . Participate in company internal compliance monitoring 145 Audits, external EASA 145 or GCAA CAR 145 Audits and demonstrate work shop regulatory compliance at all times.  To be involve into any potential optimization and/or continually improvement if its applicable for the newly built-up capabilities  Qualification To be considered for this role you must meet the below criteria Degree in Aeronautical subjects/Mechanical/Avionics/Electronic/Tech Engineering OR Aircraft Maintenance Engineering Licence OR Engineering Apprenticeship.  12 years Experience in Aircraft Maintenance Engineering related fields.  7+ Years as a certifying staff in the relevant area Airframe Components Degree in Engineering Systems/Processes or Commercial subject streams considered as an added advantage.  Capable of Auto CAD, Solid Works, CATIA V5 or similar CAD/CAM packages. Ability to produce own CAD drawings when need arises.  10+ years experience in MRO 145 work shop engineering streams as a subject matter expert of Airframe Mechanical Systems (Hydraulic Components/Pneumatic Components).    Experience Hydraulic /Pneumatic /Fuel & Oil /Landing Gears Components capability build up, preferred B-777 and A-380 related components, and the approval for components.  Project management experiences with 6 Sigma/Lean/Aircraft Component capability build up certification and proven experience with PMP, Prince 2, Agile or Lean process engineering systems.  Knowledge of latest technical developments and industry trends on respective technology Example: 3D printing, Additive Manufacturing etc.  Ability to analyse and synthesise technical information for implementation in cost effective ways  Excellent drafting/report writing skills and presentation skills.  Demonstrable experience in managing complex tasks and decision making in a fast-paced environment

title: INTERNAL COMMUNICATIONS SPECIALIST
description: In this role, you will: Drive internal communications best practice and work closely with the management team and other internal stakeholders to bring about a strategic and joined-up approach to internal communications. Develop fit-for-purpose communications content and support channels to meet the needs of diverse internal audiences. Plan, coordinate and manage internal employee events as assigned, both physical as well as virtual and hybrid. Devise and manage the production of a range of visual communications, including video, print and digital collateral, and environmental/wall branding. Devise, implement and evaluate internal communications plans on assigned projects, working closely with the relevant support departments or project managers involved. Maintain an up-to-date forward plan for the communication of projects and key initiatives, and support the team in tracking and reporting on activities and campaigns. Ensure that the content of internal communication channels, including visual assets, all work in support of the internal communications strategy, and are continually reviewed and improved. Support business unit managers and equip them with messaging, consultancy, and the tools to communicate effectively and confidently with their teams. Qualification To be considered for this role, you must meet the below requirements: A minimum of 3 years' experience in either internal or external communications. Proven editorial experience and the ability to manage a project from research stage through to implementation with little supervision. Strong understanding of communications principles. Excellent written skills, and ideally able to create simple video and other visual communications content (e.g. posters, infographics etc).  Ability to present work quickly and accurately with creative flair. Ability to analyse complex information and translate into simple messages. Ability to understand and communicate persuasively issues and policies to different target audiences groups. Tact and discretion to handle confidential information. You will have an edge if you have: ﻿ Experience in graphic or digital design, or management of design projects. Experience working on employee communications, leadership communications or employee engagement campaigns in a large or reputed company. Experience of crisis communications. Experience of working with creative agencies.

title: FIRST OFFICER
description: Job Purpose Are you a motivated and technically proficient pilot who delivers excellence? We’re looking for First Officers to join our growing team. When you join the Emirates Group, you’ll be working in a fast-paced environment and quickly develop alongside a team of professionals with diverse skills, expertise, and knowledge from all over the world. As you grow your career with us, you also enjoy a comprehensive pay and benefits package with lots of opportunities for you to explore the world. Total Pay and Benefits Package Enjoy a tax-free annual total package of up to AED 900,000 (USD 245,000). This includes: Annual take-home cash: AED 385,000 (USD 105,000), comprising annualised basic salary and flying pay Monthly take-home cash: AED 32,100 (USD 8,750), based on an average of 85 flying hours Company-provided accommodation with utilities Education allowance of AED 52,250 for primary and AED 79,750 for secondary education (up to 3 children) Annual leave entitlement of 42 calendar days Confirmed annual leave tickets for you and your dependents, upgradeable to Business Class Access to Emirates Platinum card offering exclusive retail, leisure and services discounts Concessional travel benefits for you and eligible dependents Provident (pension) scheme employer contribution Comprehensive medical, life, and accident insurance Eligibility for an annual profit share based on company performance Qualification To become a first officer, you will need a minimum of 2,000 hours total flying time. More experienced first officers, with 4,000+ hours, can expect an enhanced salary package. B777 Minimum of 2,000 hours total flying time on ≥ 20T Jet (excluding P3, rotary, and single/multi-engine piston aircraft) Minimum of 1,000 hours on Boeing Type Currently flying Boeing Type Minimum 150 hours within the past 12 months on type A valid ICAO ATPL & matching Authority Class 1 Medical certificate ICAO English Level 4 or above A380 & A350: Minimum of 2,000 hours total flying time on ≥ 50T Jet (excluding P3, rotary, and single/multi-engine piston aircraft) Minimum of 1,000 hours on Airbus FBW Currently flying Airbus FBW Minimum 150 hours within the past 12 months on type A valid ICAO ATPL & matching Authority Class 1 Medical certificate ICAO English Level 4 or above Enhanced Package Criteria: ﻿ 4,000 hours total flying time on ≥ 20T Jet (excluding P3 & rotary) Minimum of 2,000 hours total flying time on ≥ 50T Jet ICAO English Level 5 or above

title: ACCELERATED COMMAND
description: Job Purpose This is a unique opportunity for you to join as an Airbus First Officer on an enhanced salary package with an accelerated command upgrade scenario. You will need to operate the right-hand seat for a minimum of 700 stick hours and successfully complete two Evidence Based Training (EBT) recurrent training modules. Assuming you meet the standards and display the required level of performance, you will then be eligible for accelerated command via an assessment process and an upgrade course. Total Pay and Benefits Package Enjoy a tax-free annual total package of up to AED 970,000 (USD 260,000). This includes: Annual take-home cash: AED 445,000 (USD 120,000), comprising annualised basic salary and flying pay Monthly take-home cash: AED 37,100 (USD 10,000), based on an average of 85 flying hours Company-provided accommodation with utilities Education allowance of AED 52,250 for primary and AED 79,750 for secondary education (up to 3 children) Annual leave entitlement of 42 calendar days Confirmed annual leave tickets for you and your dependents, upgradeable to Business Class Access to Emirates Platinum card offering exclusive retail, leisure and services discounts Concessional travel benefits for you and eligible dependents Provident (pension) scheme employer contribution Comprehensive medical, life, and accident insurance Eligibility for an annual profit share based on company performance Qualification To join our Accelerated Command program, you will need the following experience: ﻿ Minimum of 5,000 hours total flying time (excluding P3, rotary and single/multi-engine piston aircraft)  Minimum of 2,000 hours command time on Boeing/ Airbus FBW types  Minimum 1,000 hours Airbus FBW Airbus FBW type flown within the past 3 years Minimum 150 hours in past 12 months on Airbus FBW/Boeing Valid ICAO ATPL with matching Authority Class 1 Medical ICAO English Level 5 or above

title: DIRECT ENTRY CAPTAIN
description: Total Pay and Benefits Package Enjoy a tax-free annual total package of up to AED 1,185,000 (USD 320,000). This includes: Annual take-home cash: AED 575,000 (USD 155,000), comprising annualised basic salary and flying pay Monthly take-home cash: AED 48,000 (USD 13,000), based on an average of 85 flying hours Company-provided accommodation with utilities Education allowance of AED 52,250 for primary and AED 79,750 for secondary education (up to 3 children) Annual leave entitlement of 42 calendar days Confirmed annual leave tickets for you and your dependents in Business class, upgradeable to First Class Access to Emirates Platinum card offering exclusive retail, leisure and services discounts Concessional travel benefits for you and eligible dependents in all classes of cabin Provident (pension) scheme employer contribution Comprehensive medical, life, and accident insurance, loss of medical license insurance Eligibility for an annual profit share based on company performance Qualification To become one of our Airbus Captains, you will need:  Minimum 7,000 hrs total flying time (excluding P3, rotary and single/multi-engine piston aircraft)  Minimum 150 hrs in past 12 months on Airbus FBW as a Captain  A valid ICAO ATPL with a matching Authority Class 1 Medical  ICAO English level 5 or above For A380: Minimum of 3,000 hours PIC on Airbus FBW wide-body (A330/A340/A350/A380) You must currently be flying on Airbus FBW wide-body as a Captain  For A350: Minimum of 3,000 hours PIC on any Airbus FBW (A320/A330/A340/A350/A380) You must currently be flying on Airbus FBW as a Captain

title: CABIN SERVICES ASSISTANT
description: In this role, you will: Perform inventory control function confirming products are loaded in the correct quantities. This to ensure onboard facilities can be correctly serviced, in-flight replenishments can be made and a wide range of products will be available for customers to select from in using the facilities. To check Shower Spa and lavatory cleanliness prior to passenger boarding placing appropriate amenity items to prepare for passenger use. To promptly and hygienically clean the Shower Spas after every customer use with appropriate cleaning materials, using the CSA Checklist as a guide to meet required standards. To Personalise the Shower Spa for each customer at the allocated time from the Shower Spa Reservations System, with selected products displayed in the appropriate manner to delight customers who are using the facility. To ensure no customers enter the Shower Spa once it has being personalised for a customer’s use and advise Purser if the Reservation System is running behind schedule. This will guarantee success of the Shower Spa Reservation System and maintain Shower Spa cleanliness for all our First-Class customers. To maintain clean and tidy lavatories by routinely completing the CSA Checklist to meet required standards and ensure all amenity items are available. To maintain an aesthetically pleasing, clean and safe working environment by conducting cabin tidy duties in all passenger cabins and social areas. To report any defects to the Purser so they can be rectified as soon as possible. To respect and protect company assets, the safety of colleagues and customers by immediately reporting any discrepancies, strange noises or smells, abnormal customer behavior, suspicious items to the nearest crew member so that this can be fully investigated. To report for duty on time and ensure conformance to uniform regulations. Respect and obey the chain of command on ground and in-flight and perform duties as directed by the Purser. Qualification To be considered for the role, you must meet the below requirements: 10 Years schooling or equivalent. A minimum of 2 years customer service experience with an international hotel chain/airline/world class service provider. Experience working in Hospitality Industry within housekeeping department would be an advantage. Must be fluent in written and spoken English.

title: CABIN CREW
description: Qualification Here are some other things we look for in our cabin crew: You’ve had more than a year’s experience in hospitality/customer service You have a positive attitude and the natural ability to provide excellent service in a team environment, dealing with people from many cultures Your minimum qualification is high school graduate (Grade 12) You need to be fluent in written and spoken English (ability to speak another language is an advantage) You’re at least 160cm tall and can reach 212 cm while standing on tiptoes, to enable you to reach emergency equipment on all aircraft types No visible tattoos while you’re in Emirates cabin crew uniform (without covering them with bandages or cosmetics) As Emirates cabin crew, you’ll be based in Dubai and will need to meet the UAE's employment visa requirements Aside from the requirements of the role, you should be determined to always perform to the highest standards, focus on being solution oriented, and be able to manage a demanding work schedule. You should have the ability to deliver an authentic experience to our customers. You’ll be culturally aware and reflect the Emirates personality – professional, empathetic, progressive, visionary and cosmopolitan. Before clicking the Apply button, please keep the following documents ready to submit with your application: Recent CV in English Recent photo

title: VIP CABIN CREW ( PRIVATE JETS )
description: Form the link between the passengers and the flight crew Provide a safe environment for Guests and Cabin Crew onboard through safe work practice and adequate SEP knowledge Primarily conduct the prescribed passenger services and fulfill the safety relevant tasks When requested by the Company to operate short notification flights. The ability to work under pressure and to be flexible, and understand the company complex operational requirements. Ensure re-catering for the next flight Check the cabin interior and rearrange the safety equipment where necessary Qualification/Experience: Those with experience in premium cabin or Private Jet experience will be given priority Excellent interpersonal skills to deal effectively with all business contacts Professional appearance Healthy weight which must be in proportion to height. Work varied shifts, including weekends and holidays No visible tattoos or visible body piercing Medically fit to meet air crew requirements. Well organized, self-motivated, able to work well in a team with attention to detail
